tap

Class AbstractTAPFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • tap.TAPFactory
      • tap.AbstractTAPFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UWSFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigurableTAPFactory

    public abstract class AbstractTAPFactory
extends TAPFactory
    Default implementation of most of the TAPFactory function. Only the functions related with the database connection stay abstract.
    Version:
    2.1 (01/2016)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ServiceErrorWriter errorWriter
      The error writer to use when any error occurs while executing a resource or to format an error occurring while executing an asynchronous job.

    • Field Detail

      • errorWriter

        protected final ServiceErrorWriter errorWriter
        The error writer to use when any error occurs while executing a resource or to format an error occurring while executing an asynchronous job.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTAPFactory

        protected AbstractTAPFactory(ServiceConnection service)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Build a basic TAPFactory. Nothing is done except setting the service connection.
        Parameters:
        service - Configuration of the TAP service. MUST NOT be NULL
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given ServiceConnection is NULL.
        See Also:
        AbstractTAPFactory(ServiceConnection, ServiceErrorWriter)

      • AbstractTAPFactory

        protected AbstractTAPFactory(ServiceConnection service,
                  ServiceErrorWriter errorWriter)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Build a basic TAPFactory. Nothing is done except setting the service connection and the given error writer.

        Then the error writer will be used when creating a UWS service and a job thread.

        Parameters:
        service - Configuration of the TAP service. MUST NOT be NULL
        errorWriter - Object to use to format and write the errors for the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given ServiceConnection is NULL.
        See Also:
        TAPFactory.TAPFactory(ServiceConnection)

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorWriter

        public final ServiceErrorWriter getErrorWriter()
        Description copied from class: TAPFactory

        Get the object to use when an error must be formatted and written to the user.

        This formatted error will be either written in an HTTP response or in a job error summary.

        Specified by:
        getErrorWriter in class TAPFactory
        Returns:
        The error writer to use.

        public ADQLExecutor createADQLExecutor()

        Returns:
        An ADQL executor.

      • createQueryChecker

        public final QueryChecker createQueryChecker(TAPSchema uploadSchema)
                                      throws TAPException

        This implementation gathers all tables published in this TAP service and those uploaded by the user. Then it calls createQueryChecker(Collection) with this list in order to create a query checked.

        Note: This function can not be overridded, but createQueryChecker(Collection) can be.

        Specified by:
        createQueryChecker in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        uploadSchema - ADQL schema containing the description of all uploaded tables.
        Returns:
        A query checker.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating a query checker.

      • createQueryChecker

        protected QueryChecker createQueryChecker(java.util.Collection<TAPTable> tables)
                                   throws TAPException

        Create an object able to check the consistency between the ADQL query and the database. That's to say, it checks whether the tables and columns used in the query really exist in the database.

        Note: This implementation just create a DBChecker instance with the list given in parameter.

        Parameters:
        tables - List of all available tables (and indirectly, columns).
        Returns:
        A new ADQL query checker.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating the query checker.

      • createUploader

        public Uploader createUploader(DBConnection dbConn)
                        throws TAPException

        This implementation just create an Uploader instance with the given database connection.

        Note: This function should be overrided if you need to change the DB name of the TAP_UPLOAD schema. Indeed, by overriding this function you can specify a given TAPSchema to use as TAP_UPLOAD schema in the constructor of Uploader. But do not forget that this TAPSchema instance MUST have an ADQL name equals to "TAP_UPLOAD", otherwise, a TAPException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        createUploader in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        dbConn - The database connection which has requested an Uploader.
        Returns:
        An Uploader.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating an Uploader instance.

      • createUWS

        public UWSService createUWS()
                     throws TAPException

        This implementation just create a UWSService instance.

        Note: This implementation is largely enough for a TAP service. It is not recommended to override this function.

        Specified by:
        createUWS in class TAPFactory
        Returns:
        A UWS service which will be the asynchronous resource of this TAP service.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating this UWS service.

      • createUWSBackupManager

        public UWSBackupManager createUWSBackupManager(UWSService uws)
                                        throws TAPException

        This implementation does not provided a backup manager. It means that no asynchronous job will be restored and backuped.

        You must override this function if you want enable the backup feature.

        Specified by:
        createUWSBackupManager in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        uws - The UWS service which has to be backuped and restored.
        Returns:
        The backup manager to use. MAY be NULL
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating this backup manager.

      • createTAPJob

        protected TAPJob createTAPJob(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  JobOwner owner)
                       throws UWSException

        This implementation provides a basic TAPJob instance.

        If you need to add or modify the behavior of some functions of a TAPJob, you must override this function and return your own extension of TAPJob.

        Specified by:
        createTAPJob in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        request - Request which contains all parameters needed to set correctly the asynchronous job to create.
        owner - The user which has requested the job creation.
        Returns:
        A new PENDING asynchronous job.
        Throws:
        UWSException - If any error occurs while reading the parameters in the request or while creating the job.

      • createTAPJob

        protected TAPJob createTAPJob(java.lang.String jobId,
                  JobOwner owner,
                  TAPParameters params,
                  long quote,
                  long startTime,
                  long endTime,
                  java.util.List<Result> results,
                  ErrorSummary error)
                       throws UWSException

        This implementation provides a basic TAPJob instance.

        If you need to add or modify the behavior of some functions of a TAPJob, you must override this function and return your own extension of TAPJob.

        Specified by:
        createTAPJob in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        jobId - ID of the job (NOT NULL).
        owner - Owner of the job.
        params - List of all input job parameters.
        quote - Its quote (in seconds).
        startTime - Date/Time of the start of this job.
        endTime - Date/Time of the end of this job.
        results - All results of this job.
        error - The error which ended the job to create.
        Returns:
        A new PENDING asynchronous job.
        Throws:
        UWSException - If there is an error while creating the job.

      • createTAPParameters

        public TAPParameters createTAPParameters(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                                  throws TAPException

        This implementation extracts standard TAP parameters from the given request.

        Non-standard TAP parameters are added in a map inside the returned TAPParameters object and are accessible with UWSParameters.get(String) and UWSParameters.getAdditionalParameters(). However, if you want to manage them in another way, you must extend TAPParameters and override this function in order to return an instance of your extension.

        Specified by:
        createTAPParameters in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        request - The HTTP request containing the TAP parameters to extract.
        Returns:
        An object gathering all successfully extracted TAP parameters.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while extracting the parameters.

      • createTAPParameters

        public TAPParameters createTAPParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
                                  throws TAPException

        This implementation extracts standard TAP parameters from the given request.

        Non-standard TAP parameters are added in a map inside the returned TAPParameters object and are accessible with UWSParameters.get(String) and UWSParameters.getAdditionalParameters(). However, if you want to manage them in another way, you must extend TAPParameters and override this function in order to return an instance of your extension.

        Specified by:
        createTAPParameters in class TAPFactory
        Parameters:
        params - Map containing all parameters.
        Returns:
        An object gathering all successfully identified TAP parameters.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If any error occurs while creating the TAPParameters object.
